result.execSummary:
Andre S Heartz was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Andre S Heartz was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre S Heartz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special prosecutor Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft wishes to waive extradition in Waukegan, Illinois.  Deft signs the extradition papers.  Court grants the extradition.  Deft may be surrendered to the Waukegan authorities.

121 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody. Clk LE.  Deft waives his right to counsel.  Referred to Br 3 for further dispo on 11/4/14 @ 115 pm. - Extradition waiver hearing.  Deft wishes to waive extradition.  $5000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
and witness list filed by the State
